doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.label:
Print information in neat, aligned columns.?
Yes No
Set this option on (Y) to print the sequence information into neat, aligned columns in the output file. Alternatively, leave it unset (N), in which case the information records will be delimited by a character, which you may specify by using the -delimiter option. In other words, if -columns is set on, the -delimiter option is overriden.

Delimiter of records in text output file?
This string, which is usually a single character only, is used to delimit individual records in the text output file. It could be a space character, a tab character, a pipe character or any other character or string.

Name of the output file (e_outfile)?
If you enter the name of a file here then this program will write the sequence details into that file.
Format output as an html table Yes No

Display the specified columns?
Yes No
This is a way of shortening the command line if you only want a few things to be displayed. Instead of specifying: '-nohead -noname -noacc -notype -nopgc -nodesc' to get only the length output, you can specify '-only -length'
Display column headings Yes No
Display the usa of the sequence Yes No
Display 'database' column Yes No
Display 'name' column Yes No
Display 'accession' column Yes No
Display 'gi' column Yes No
Display 'version' column Yes No
Display 'type' column Yes No
Display 'length' column Yes No
Display 'percent gc content' column Yes No
Display 'organism' column Yes No
Display 'description' column Yes No

div.title: This parameter is mandatory

Alternatively, leave it unset (N), in which case the information records will be delimited by a character, which you may specify by using the -delimiter option. In other words, if -columns is set on, the -delimiter option is overriden.

If you enter the name of a file here then this program will write the sequence details into that file.

This is a way of shortening the command line if you only want a few things to be displayed. Instead of specifying: '-nohead -noname -noacc -notype -nopgc -nodesc' to get only the length output, you can specify '-only -length'

parameter.name: e_columns
parameter.prompt: Print information in neat, aligned columns.

comment.text: Set this option on (Y) to print the sequence information into neat, aligned columns in the output file. Alternatively, leave it unset (N), in which case the information records will be delimited by a character, which you may specify by using the -delimiter option. In other words, if -columns is set on, the -delimiter option is overriden.

parameter.name: e_delimiter
parameter.prompt: Delimiter of records in text output file

format.code: ("", " -delimiter=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: This string, which is usually a single character only, is used to delimit individual records in the text output file. It could be a space character, a tab character, a pipe character or any other character or string.
